the collapse of such a dictatorship was ''inevitable'' in Egypt, as well as in other countries throughout the world. ''What comes next, it's hard to predict,'' Patrick Leahy said. A huge part of( Egypt's) natural product is tourism. They've got to get tourists feeling free to go back. Nobody's about to book a trip to Egypt right now. ''The United States really needs stability there, Patrick Leahy continued, ''because of our interests in Israel and Jordan and elsewhere.'' Sen. Bernie Sanders , I-Vt., had a similar response and called on the United States to support a transition to democracy.

Eric Schmidt , previously CEO of Novell and CTO of Sun Microsystems, has by far the most enterprise experience in the triumvirate that runs Google, which also includes co-founder Sergey Brin . Eric Schmidt clearly had passion for enterprise software, says Gartner analyst Whit Andrews. ''He cared about enterprise software. He worked at a lot of companies that sold enterprise software and bunch of enterprise products. That history is not in place with Page.''

2011, 5:27 pm WINDSOR, Ontario( AP)-- Chrysler is debating the future of its minivans even as it starts making the 2011 Dodge Grand Caravan and Chrysler Town and Country this week. We need to completely rethink the minivan, CEO Sergio Marchionne said Tuesday at the Canadian plant where Chrysler's minivans are made. ''We need to retain all its functionality but make it much more versatile.'' Sergio Marchionne said that could mean new products

- NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell is not concerned about Michael Vick being billed as hosting a Super Bowl party because the Eagles quarterback told him it's not true. He has said that on numerous occasions people have been using his name about being involved in some type of a party and he had no intention of participating in that, Roger Goodell said. City resident George Rombach appealed the Planning Commission approval of the project to the City Council, arguing that other houses of worship were held to more stringent land use requirements- a claim rebuffed by city officials. Last year, residents flooded the city with letters about the mosque and attended raucous hearings about the project. Supporters rallied around the Islamic community and cited the contributions made by American Muslims. ''The hallmark of our country is that we allow all faiths and beliefs to be practiced and that we, as a country, tend to give people the benefit of the doubt until they prove differently, Ada Hand wrote to the commission.
